original_text:
Medicine Progress
**INSTITUTION
Patient :
**NAME[AAA , BBB] F
MRN - **ID-NUM - MPACCOMMMRN
Age :
**AGE[in 80s] years
Sex :
Male
DOB :
**DATE[Jun 14 1922]
Author :
**NAME[XXX , WWW M]
Health Status
Summary of Hospitalization :
This **AGE[in 80s] year old , widowed , white male with h/o NPH , CAD , s/p CABG presents to ED with h/o difficulty with ambulation , urinary incontinence and worsening dementia per family .
Past Medical History :
Dementia
NPH
CAD , s/p CABG
HTN
A-fib , on Coumadin
Hyperlipidemia
TIA
Carotid stenosis
Spinal stenosis
BPH
Subjective / Events Overnight :
Chart and labs reviewed .
Patient seen at bedside .
No specific complaints today .
Pt. with continued confusion , but much less agitiation as per nursing staff .
Vital signs
**DATE[Jul 23 2007] 4:00:00 AM .
BP : systolic 126 , diastolic 61 .
Pulse :
62 beats per min .
Resp :
20 breaths / min .
Temp :
36.7 degrees Celsius .
Pulse Oximetry ( O2 Sats ) :
99% on RA .
Physical Exam
General Appearance :
Pt. lying in bed sleeping in NAD .
Cardiovascular :
Distant heart tones .
RRR without murmurs .
Respiratory :
CTA throughout .
Gastrointestinal :
NABS x 4 .
Soft , nontender , nondistended .
Skin :
Warm , dry , and intact .
Skin on back + blanched macular rash .
Neurological :
Pt. awake and alert .
Oriented to person only .
Extremities : no e/c/c in BLE .
Current medications reviewed
General Results
Today 's results :
ALLRESLTSECT
**DATE[Jul 24 2007] 2:03 PM
Discharge Plan
DP
( Preliminary )
**DATE[Jul 24 2007] 4:00 AM
Na 140 mEq / L
K 4.7 mEq / L
Cl 106 mEq / L
CO2 26 mEq / L
Anion Gap 8.0
BUN 33 mg / dL High
Cr 1.6 mg / dL High
GFR ( estimated ) 44.00 mL / min / 1.73 m2 Low
( Modified )
Glucose 95 mg / dL
Ca 8.6 mg / dL
WBC 6.5 X10E+09 / L
RBC 3.78 X10E+12 / L Low
Hgb 11.2 gm / dL Low
Hct 32.1 % Low
MCV 84.9 fL
MCH 29.6 pg
MCHC 34.8 gm / dL
RDW 14.9 %
MPV 8.1 fL
Platelets 220 X10E+09 / L
Neutrophils 55 %
Lymphs 29 %
Monocytes 11 %
Eosinophils 4 %
Basophils 1 %
ABS Neutrophils 3.60 X10E+09 / L
ABS Lymphs 1.90 X10E+09 / L
ABS Monocytes 0.70 X10E+09 / L
ABS Eosinophils 0.30 X10E+09 / L
ABS Basophils 0.00 X10E+09 / L
Type of Differential
Automated Differential
Other Studies :
MRI / MRA 1/17 :
SMALL VESSEL DISEASE CHANGES ARE SEEN ALONG WITH SOME PROMINENCE OF THE VENTRICULAR SYSTEM .
MR ANGIOGRAM INTRACRANIAL VESSELS :
FINDINGS :
3-D time - of - flight sequences of the intracranial vessels were obtained .
There is some minimal vessel irregularity of most intracranial branches in particular , the posterior cerebral arteries .
No major vessel cut off or occlusion is identified .
No suggestion of intracranial aneurysm is seen .
Mild irregularity , probably representing minor atheromatous disease is seen in the carotid siphon bilaterally .
The distal vertebral arteries and basilar artery are unremarkable .
IMPRESSION :
MILD INTRACRANIAL ATHEROMATOUS CHANGES ARE NOTED .
Impression and Plan
Impression
**AGE[in 80s] yo male admitted with worsening dementia , urinary incontinence , and difficulty ambulating ; pt. to undergo lumbar drain trial for NPH evaluation .
Plan
1. Neurological - h/o dementia , NPH , TIA .
Admitted with worsening dementia and ambulation .
Neurology consulted - input appreciated .
Patient was on Aricept in past with no benefit , but side effects per attending , therefore , will not resume at this time .
MRI C-Spine :
IMPRESSION : MULTILEVEL DEGENERATIVE CHANGES OF THE CERVICAL SPINE AS ABOVE WHICH ARE MOST SIGNIFICANT AT THE C5-C6 LEVEL WHERE THERE IS CORD COMPRESSION AND MILD CENTRAL CANAL STENOSIS BUT NO ABNORMAL CORD SIGNAL .
B-12 level 372 .
Pt. with continued confusion , but much less agitation today .
Neurosurgery consulted ( 7897 ) to evaluate for trial of CSF removal and their impression of compression .
Recommended NPH evaluation with lumbar drain trial .
Geriatric Psych c/s for acute change in dementia - appreciate input .
Recommended MRI brain for further w/u of ischemic etiology and to eval. for TIA .
Also rec. to replace Vit. B12 due to low end nml level .
Consider further eval. for Parkinson 's disease .
No psychiatric indication for a diagnostic spinal tap .
Attending waiting for input then will address with son , **NAME[VVV , UUU].
Pt. seen by psych 1/18 - feel that the pt. somewhat improved .
He was able to name objects and state days of the week .
Feel that pt. may have a worsening delerium superimposed upon upon his baseline dementia .
Rec. to avoid benzos and anticholinergics .
Appreciate input .
MRI 1/17 revealed small vessel changes ; MRA 1/17 revealed mild changes .
Lumbar drain placed 1/22 for NPH eval.
NSG following for LD output with goal 5-10 per hour .
PT following for DGI testing daily .
CSF 1/23 reveals clear colorless fluid with slightly elevated protein , otherwise WNL .
Pt given Haldol x 1 yesterday for agitation .
Will try to avoid further use of sedatives .
2. Cardiology - h/o CAD , s/p CABG , A-fib .
Pt. remains in NSR .
Coumadin currently on hold for trial while LD in place .
Per attending , no need to bridge with Heparin .
Will need to be restarted on Coumadin prior to d/c if deemed safe - h/o multiple falls .
Continue other meds and observe .
3. Renal - Pt. found to have + protein in urine upon admission .
Repeat U/A to R/O UTI contributing to altered MS .
1/18 revealed 30 + protein as well as blood noted .
BUN / Cr increased as well .
4. Disposition - Placement has been initiated .
Family will need to discuss further pending the results of NPH trial .
Professional Services
Credentials and Title of Author **NAME[TTT] Signing this Document : PA-C
Perform by **NAME[XXX , WWW M]
( on **DATE[Jul 24 2007] 16:14 )
Sign by **NAME[XXX , WWW M]
( on **DATE[Jul 24 2007] 16:14 )
VERIFY by **NAME[XXX , WWW M]
( on **DATE[Jul 24 2007] 16:14 )
